This seminar is intended for advanced bachelor and master level students with a
background in (infinite-dimensional) control theory and optimization
. The goal is to provide an overview of ongoing research activities in the fields of
control theory, model order reduction, data-driven approximations and PDE constrained optimization

Each seminar participant is expected to study and present a research topic (see the list below) and to write a short summary of the main results. Participation in the seminar is limited to 12 students.
Interested students choose (at most) 3 out of these 12 articles and send an email to me with the corresponding titles (with or without a ranking for preferences) until April 15, 2024.

I will distribute the articles based on the replies and prepare a list of seminar participants until April 21, 2024. Please note that participation in the seminar is not based on a first-come, first-served basis but on the particular topical availability/thematical fit.
A first meeting with the participants in order to discuss questions will be held in the week of April 22, 2024.

The presentations will be held in presence in a block format at 2 days towards the end of the semester, most likely Monday, July 1 and Monday, July 8. The exact slots will be specified once the topics have been distributed.
Participants are expected to attend all the presentations.
Each participant has to submit a summary of the main results (up to 5 pages) by July 26, 2024.
